metadata.title: CVE-2019-12921 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In GraphicsMagick before 1.3.32, the text filename component allows remoteattackers to read arbitrary files via a crafted image because ofTranslateTextEx for SVG.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm7').
